The Brethren with falſe Calumnies,
Is now caſt head-long down, and none
Give credit longer to his Lyes.
v.11 He's conquer'd by the Blood of Chriſt,
And by their witneſs to his word:
start from here tomorrow
Theſe valued not their Lives, but dy'd
For Love unto their deareſt Lord.
v.12 Ye heav'nly Spirits above, rejoyce;
But woe to th' Earth below; whoſe hurt
The Dev'il with utmoſt rage contrives,
Knowing his time to do't's but ſhort.
Ch.19.v.1 Salvation to our God belongs,
Glory and Honour are his due;
His Pow'r ſupreme, and all proclaim
His Judgments to be juſt and true.
v.2 He the great Whore has judg'd, which did
Corrupt with Idols every Land;
And has aveng'd the crying Blood
Of his ſlain Servants at her hand.
v.6 Now let both Heav'n and Earth aloud
Their praiſing Hallelujah's ſing;
For the Lord God Almighty reigns,
And ſhews himſelf a glorious King.
v.17 In Honour of the Lamb of God,
Let's triumph on his Nuptial day;
The time is come, and his chaſt Bride
Stands ready dreſt in rich Array.
O God we praiſe thee, and we own
Thee to be Lord and King alone.
All the whole Earth doth worſhip thee,
Thou Father from Eternity.
To thee all Angels loudly cry,
The Heav'ns and all the Pow'rs on high;
Cherubs and Seraphins proclaim,
And cry thrice Holy to thy Name.
Lord God of Hoſts, thy preſence bright
Fills Heav'n and Earth with beauteous light.
The Apoſtles glorious Company,
The Prophet's Fellowſhip, praiſe thee.
The crowned Martyrs Noble Hoſt,
The Holy Church in every Coaſt,
Thine infinite perfections own,
Father of Majeſty unknown.
Giving all Adoration
Unto thy true and onely Son:
And to the Holy Ghoſt, from whom
As the ſole Spring our Comforts come.
O Chriſt, thou glorious King, we own
Thee to be God's Eternal Son:
Who our Deliv'rance to obtain,
Did'ſt not the Virgins Womb diſdain.
When Death's ſharp ſting deſtroy'd by thee
Gave thee a glorious Victory;
Heav'ns Gate; that Entrance had deny'd,
To all Believers opened wide.
Thou, Lord, at God's Right hand art plac'd,
And with thy Father's Glory grac'd;
And we believe the Day will come,
When thou as Judge ſhall paſs our doom.
Promote we pray thy Servants good,
Redeemed with thy precious Blood;
Among thy Saints make them aſcend
To Glory that ſhall never End.
Thy People with Salvation crown;
Bleſs thoſe, O God, that are thine own:
Govern and liſt them up on high.
Thee, Lord, we dily magnify.
Thy Name we worſhip and adore,
Ever when time ſhall be more:
Vouchſafe this Day to keep us pure;
From Harms and wilfull Sins ſecure.
O let thy Mercy, Lord, deſcend
On us, whoſe hopes on thee depend:
Lord, ſince my Truſt is fixt on thee,
O let me ne'er confounded be.

div.l: GLory to God in Heav'n above;
Let th' Earth below with Peace be bleſt:
From the Divine Benignity,
Greateſt Good-will towards Men expreſt.
GLory to God in Heav'n above,
Let th' Earth with Peace be bleſt:
From the Divine Benignity,
Good-will tow'rds Men expreſt.

div.head: [As the 25 Pſalm.]
div.l: GLory to God in Heav'n,
Let th' Earth with Peace be bleſt:
From the Divine Benignity,
Good-will tow'rds Menexpreſt.
TO thee, O Father, to the Son,
And Holy Ghoſt whom we adore;
Be Glory, as it was of Old,
Is now, and ſhall be evermore.
TO thee, O Father, to the Son;
And Holy Ghoſt we give
Glory that was of Old, is now,
And ſhall this World ſurvive.
TO thee, O Father, Son,
And Holy Ghoſt we give
Glory that was of Old, is now,
And ſhall this World outlive.

div.head: AN EXPLICATION OF Some WORDS Of leſs Common Uſe, For the Benefit of the Common People.

list.head: Words leſs common, Their Signification.
list.label: ACquired
Audacious
Benignity
Celebrate
Climes
list.item: Country's differing in length of days.

Lower Sphere

Orbs, Spheres

Unceſſant
Undeclining
Unexhauſted

div.head: A TABLE, To find any PSALM Knowing its Beginning.

row.cell: A.
Pſalm.
All People round the Earth your Ears (2n Met.)
All the Earth's Praiſes to thy Name
As by Euphrates Streams we ſat
B.
Pſalm.
EEhold my troubles Lord
Behold, O Lord, my ſinfull Soul—(2d Met.)
Behold, O Lord, with ſavage Rage
Bleſt be the Lord the God of Might
Bleſt Fountain of my Joys, for thee-(2d Met.)
Bleſt is the Man that fears the Lord
Bleſt is the Man whoſe fear of God
Bleſt is the Man whoſe tender Senſe
Bleſt is the Man whoſe vertuous Steps
Bleſs thou the Lord my Soul, his name
Bleſs thou the Lord my Soul, to this-(2d Met)
By cheerfull Praiſes to his Name
C.
Pſalm.
CErtain it is that God is kind
Come let us all unite our Joys
Come let us with united Joys-(2d Met.)
D.
Pſalm.
DIvinely now inſpir'd I'll ſing
Do not, O Lord, in our diſireſs
E.
Pſalm.
EArly, O Lord, my fainting Soul
F.
Pſalm.
FAlſly accus'd to thee I fly
Fools in their hearts have ſaid, no God (2d Met.)
G.
Pſalm.
GIve thanks unto the Lord
God is my Saviour and my Light
God is my Shepherd who will ſee
God reigns, let all the Earth rejoyce—(2d Met.)
God that ſo gracious a regard (2d Met.)
God who my kind preſerver is
Great Judge of all the World be thou (2d Met.)
Great Praiſes to the greateſt Lord
Great ſhepherd of good Jacob's Race
H.
Pſalm.
HAD not the Lord our Cauſe eſpous'd
Hear me, O Lord, my ſure Defence
Hear me, O Lord, the great Support
He's happy, whom no wicked Mens-(2d Met.)
r
He that has God for his retreat
He who makes God his ſure retreat (2d Met.)
How beauteous is the place where thou
How long ſhall I complain like one—(1ſt & 2d Met.)
How well are we imploy'd topraiſe—(2d Met.)
I.
Pſalm.
Iall my Love on thee beſtow
If thou Lord doſt not riſe and help
I'll liſt mine Eyes unto the Hills
In Juſt diſpleaſure for our Sins
In my diſtreſs my Pray'rs and Cries
I truſt in God why ſhould I then
It's ſure that God is kind to thoſe-(2d Met.)
I was reſolv'd t' obſerve my ways-(2d Met.)
I will extoll thy ſacred Name
L.
Pſalm.
LET all give thanks to God above
Let all the Earth their Voices raiſe(1 & 2 Met.)
Let all the Earth with joy reſound
Let all the Nations of the Earth
Let all the Nations of the World
Let all the People round the Earth.
Let none be envious when he ſees
Let none be troubled to behold (2d Met.)
Let th' Earth rejoyce ſince God do's reign
Let the Great God ariſe and then
Lord bow thine Ear to my requeſts
Lord every Age and Race has ſeen-(1 & 2 Met.)
Lord hear me and from wicked Foes
Lord hear my Pray'r and do not hide
Lord hear my words attend the moans
Lord hear the Pray'rs and mournfull Cries
Lord hear the ſilent Moans and Sighs-(2d Met.)
Lord I can ſuffer thy Rebukes
Lord I can well endure, when thou—(2d Met.)
Lord if thou do'ſt not come and help-(2d Met.)
Lord, I have no aſpiring Thoughts
Lord let me know that happy Man
Lord look upon my ſinfull Soul
Lord may the King with mighty Skill
Lord not to us but to thy Name (2n Met.)
Lord ſave me from mine Enemies
Lord ſave me from the Man who bears
Lord ſince I truſt in thee alone
Lord ſince my glorying is in thee
Lord thy Rebukes I can endure
Lord when I have to do with thee
M.
Pſalm.
MAintin, O Lord, my injur'd Rights
May no defeated hopes diſgrace
Mercy and Judgment Lord I'll ſing
My God my God why thus withdrawn
My God ſince thou haſt rais'd me up
My heart, O God, is now prepar'd
My People to my words give Ear
My Soul's heſt Pow'rs I will engag
My Soul bleſs thou the Lord, his Name (2d Met)
My Soul doth wait on God
My Soul for ever bleſs the Lord
My Soul on God relies
My Soul to praiſe the higheſt Lord
N.
Pſalm.
NOne knows like Judah God ſo well
Not unto us Lord, not to us
O.
Pſalm.
O.all ye People clap your hands
O bleſt Employment of our Lives
O bleſt Societſes'on Earth
G God my Saviour Night and Day
O God the Spring of all my Joys
O happy Companies on Earth-(2d Met.)
O happy Man that fears the Lord-(2d Met.)
O happy Man whom God forgives
O let us all give thanks to God
O Lord how joyfull is the King
O my good God in thee I truſt-(1 & 2 Met.)
O praiſe the Lord whom Ages paſt
O thou that in a glorious Throve
O what a pleſant Work it is
P.
Pſalm.
PLac'd on the Holy Hills God's Seat
Plead thou my Cauſe, O thou that know'ſt
Plung'd into Depths of Miſery-(1 & 2 Met.)
Praiſe God and let your Songs be new
Praiſe God within that ſacred Place
Praiſe him to whom all Pow'r belongs
Praiſes in Sion wait for thee-(1 & 2 Met.)
Preſerve me Lord in thi s diſtreſs
R.
Pſalm.
REgard, O Lord, my Pray'r and Cry
Regard the fervent Pray'rs I make
Rojoyce ye Righteous in the Lord-(2d Met.)
Remember all the troubles Lord
Render, and oft your thanks repeat—(2d Met.)
Renew your Songs to God, and tell
Reſcue my Life in Mercy Lord
Reſolv'd I was with care t' obſerve
S.
Pſalm.
SAve me, O God, or elſe I'm drown'd
Save me, O God, thy glorious Name
Shew mercy to us Lerd
Since God ſo tender a Regard
Since thou haſt rais'd me I'll extoll—(2d Met.)
T.
Pſalm.
TH' Almighty Lord is our Defence
The Earth's the Lord's, to him belong
The Fools believe no God
The Fools believe there is no God
The Glorious Empire of the Lord
The Heavns whoſe beauteous Frame we ſee
The Lord do's reign and clothes himſelf-(2d Met.)
The Lord do's reign and like a King
The Lord do's reign and on his Throne
The Lord my woatchfull Shepherd is-(2d Met.)
The Lord to thy requeſts give ear
The mighty God and Lord of all
The Wonders Lord thon did'ſt of old
They that in God their confidence
They that repoſe their truſt in God—(2d Met.)
Thou great Avenger of all wrongs
Thou Righteous Judge of all the World
Thrice happy are thoſe upright Men
Thus ſpake the Lord unto his Son—(1 & 2 Met.)
Thy Mercy Lord has chang'd our doom
Thy ſacred Name I will advance—(2d Met.
'Tis good with Patience to attend
To God I make my Pray'r
To God whoſe care I've ever been
To laud the heav'nly King
To magniſy the Lord my Soul
To my importunate requeſts
'Twas no ſmall Joy many to hear
U.
Pſalm.
VAin mighty Man to vaunt it ſo
Unleſs God proſper it, all coſt
W.
Pſalm.
WE'll never ceaſe to thank our God
We that are Iſr'alites may ſay
What Numbers Lord againſt me riſe
Whtn God from bondage ſet us free
When God redeem'd our captive State (2d Met.)
When I behold a Wicked Man
When Lord I deal with thee, in vain-(2d Met.)
When the Great God had Ifr'els Seed
Why do the Heathen Nations rage
Why Lord do'ſt thou ſo far withdraw
Will God for ever caſt off thoſe
With all my Soul I'll bleſs the Lord
With cheerfull heart I'll ever ſing
With fervent Cries I did implore
